title: Exchange of simulation data between CFD program and a multi-segmented human thermal comfort model.

references.title: A computer model of human thermoregulation for a wide range of environmental conditions: The passive system,
references.raw: Fiala D, Lomas KJ and Stohrer M, (1999), A computer model of human thermoregulation for a wide range of environmental conditions: The passive system, Journal of Applied Physiology, Vol. 87 (5), pp 1957-1972.

references.title: A coupled model for predicting heat and mass transfer from a human body to its surroundings,
references.raw: Al-Mogbel A, (2003), A coupled model for predicting heat and mass transfer from a human body to its surroundings, Proc. 36 th AIAA Thermophysics Conference Florida, AIAA 2003-4211.

references.title: A new simulation system for predicting human thermal and perceptual responses in vehicles,
references.raw: Fiala D, Bunzl A, Lomas KJ, Cropper PC and Schlenz D, (2004), A new simulation system for predicting human thermal and perceptual responses in vehicles, in Schlenz D (Ed) PKW-Klimatisierung III: Klimakonzepte, Regelungsstrategien und Entwicklungsmethoden, Haus der Technik Fachbuch, Expert Verlag, Renningen, Band 27, pp 147-162, ISBN 3 8169 2268 6.

references.title: A new simulation system to predict human-environment thermal interactions in naturally ventilated buildings,
references.raw: Yang T, Cropper PC, Cook MJ, Yousaf R and Fiala D, (2007), A new simulation system to predict human-environment thermal interactions in naturally ventilated buildings, Proc. th International Building Performance Simulation Association Conference and

references.title: A standard predictive index of human response to the thermal environment,
references.raw: Gagge A, Fobelets A, and Berglund L, (1986), A standard predictive index of human response to the thermal environment, ASHRAE Trans 92(2): 709-731.

references.title: An introduction to computational fluid dynamics – the finite volume method, Longman Group Ltd.
references.raw: Versteeg HK and Malalasekera W, (1995). An introduction to computational fluid dynamics – the finite volume method, Longman Group Ltd. ISBN 0-582-21884-5.

references.title: ANSYS CFX Help, Release 11.0, ANSYS CFX Users Guide, http://www.ansys.com Cook MJ and Short CA,
references.raw: ANSYS Inc, (2007), ANSYS CFX Help, Release 11.0, ANSYS CFX Users Guide, http://www.ansys.com Cook MJ and Short CA, (2005), Natural Ventilation and Low Energy Cooling of Large, NonDomestic Buildings - Four Case Studies, The International Journal of Ventilation, Vol. 3 No 4, pp 283-294.

references.title: Combined simulation of airflow, radiation and moisture transport for heat release from a human body, Building and Environment,
references.raw: Murakami S, Kato S and Zeng J, (2000), Combined simulation of airflow, radiation and moisture transport for heat release from a human body, Building and Environment, 35(6): 489-500.

references.title: Computer prediction of human thermoregulatory and temperature responses to a wide range of environmental conditions,
references.raw: Fiala D, Lomas KJ and Stohrer M, (2001), Computer prediction of human thermoregulatory and temperature responses to a wide range of environmental conditions, International Journal of Biometeorology, Vol. 45, pp 143-159.

references.title: Convective and radiative heat transfer coefficients for individual body segments,
references.raw: de Dear, RJ, Arens A, Hui Z and Oguro M, (1997), Convective and radiative heat transfer coefficients for individual body segments, International Journal of Biometerol, Vol. 40, pp 141-156.

references.title: Coupled Simulation of Convection and Radiation on Thermal Environment around an Accurately Shaped Human Body.
references.raw: Omori T, Yang JH, Kato S and Murakami S, (2004), Coupled Simulation of Convection and Radiation on Thermal Environment around an Accurately Shaped Human Body. Proc. 9 th international conference - RoomVent 2004. Portugal, pp.7. Short CA and Cook MJ, (2005), Design Guidance for Naturally Ventilated Theatres, Building Services Engineering Research and Technology, Vol. 26, No. 3, pp 259-270.

references.title: Evaluation of thermal comfort using combined multi-node thermoregulation (65MN) and radiation models and computational fluid dynamics (CFD),
references.raw: Tanabe S, Kobayashi K, Nakano J, Ozeki Y and Konishi M, (2002), Evaluation of thermal comfort using combined multi-node thermoregulation (65MN) and radiation models and computational fluid dynamics (CFD), Energy and Buildings, 34(6): 637-646.

references.title: First Principles Modelling of Thermal Sensation Responses in Steady State and Transient Boundary Conditions,
references.raw: Fiala D, Lomas, KJ and Stohrer M, (2003), First Principles Modelling of Thermal Sensation Responses in Steady State and Transient Boundary Conditions, ASHRAE Transactions, Vol. 109 (1), pp179-186.

references.title: Thermal comfort.
references.raw: Fanger, PO, (1970), Thermal comfort. Danish Technical Press, Copenhagen, Denmark.

references.title: Two-equation eddy-viscosity turbulence models for engineering applications,
references.raw: Menter FR, (1994), Two-equation eddy-viscosity turbulence models for engineering applications, AIAA Journal 32, pp 1598-1605.
